predefined_profiles.name: Li Fei
predefined_profiles.public profile: Li Fei is a university student who loves traveling. During vacations, he usually goes on trips with his roommates and friends. He is cheerful, lively, well-liked, and values loyalty. This time, taking advantage of the short school holiday, he has bought plane tickets early with his roommate Wu Tong to go on a trip.
predefined_profiles.goal: Survive safely on the plane when encountering zombies.

predefined_profiles.name: Wu Tong
predefined_profiles.public profile: Wu Tong is Li Fei's roommate. Wu Tong's family is not very well-off, and he lives frugally, but he is straightforward and honest.
predefined_profiles.goal: Survive on the plane when encountering zombies.
predefined_profiles.private profile: Wu Tong is somewhat envious of Li Fei.

scenario: Li Fei and his roommate Wu Tong bought plane tickets to go on a trip during the school's short holiday. After boarding the plane, they unfortunately encountered zombies on the flight. As the protagonist, Wu Tong must make the right choices to survive as long as possible.

dialog.content: Li Fei and his roommate Wu Tong bought plane tickets for a short vacation from school. After boarding the plane, they unfortunately encountered zombies. As the main character, Wu Tong must make the right choices to survive as long as possible.

(The night before their departure, Li Fei and Wu Tong were wandering around the night market at the school gate and came across a clothing stall. The stall owner praised Li Fei and even recommended him a leather jacket, saying it would suit him perfectly.) The quality does look quite good. Old Wu, what do you think? Does it suit me? Do I look good in it?
Yeah, it’s up to you whether you want it or not.
Ah, I'm a bit tempted but also a little hesitant.
(The owner is still recommending enthusiastically) So, are you going to buy it or not?

content.content: The owner is so enthusiastic, and the price seems reasonable. Both of us would be happy, so I'll go ahead and buy it. Wrap it up, please.

question: #question# How can Li Fei make the stall owner happy when shopping for clothes?

content.content: (A bit hesitant) Old Wu, don't just say it's fine, tell me if it really works or not. I'll listen to you.
Owner, stop flattering me. I think you're just trying to sell the clothes by exaggerating.
(Inspecting the clothes) Owner, there are quite a few loose threads here. I don't really like it. I'll check other places.
Nah, forget it. I don't really need clothes. Since we're planning to travel, we should save a little money. Let's go.

question: #question# How can Li Fei remind himself of his goal to have a good trip amid the temptation of the leather jacket?

content.content: (Secretly likes it a lot) Oh man, I really love it. I should just buy it, or I won’t be able to sleep.
It's just a leather jacket, how much could it cost? If I like it, I'll spend the money.
(Hesitant, whispers to Wu Tong) Should I buy it or not? I'm afraid the owner will be upset if I don't buy it.

dialog.content: Haha, that's just your style.

(The next morning, wearing new clothes, Li Fei and Wu Tong head to the airport. It's off-peak season for travel. After passing security and arriving at check-in, a staff member mentions a special offer to upgrade to first class. Li Fei says) No way, I just spent my money on new clothes yesterday. I'll pass, maybe next time. Old Wu, do you want to give it a try?
I'll pass too, flying already costs me so much. We didn't even get seats together, where will I find spare cash for first class?
(The two proceed to board the plane) Ah, Wu Tong, my seat is by the window and I'm afraid of window seats, what do I do?
(At the same time, two people next to Li Fei arrive and sit down) If you're really scared, why don't you ask the person in the aisle seat if they would mind switching with you?

content.content: Okay! I'll ask them. I'm sure everyone is willing to help, people will help me.

question: #question# How can Li Fei demonstrate an optimistic attitude when seeking help from passengers around him?

content.content: (Pessimistic) Sigh, they surely won't want to change seats, who would want to sit by the window?
I'm really out of luck, just missed a first class opportunity and now stuck with this window seat.
I'm fed up, I'll ask the flight attendant, I demand to switch seats!
Maybe the person doesn't like window seats either. I can't keep bothering people and making things inconvenient for others, I'll just have to endure it.

question: #question# How can Li Fei show self-reflection when deciding whether to seek help from the passenger beside him?

content.content: It's okay, I think everyone is pretty kind, surely people will be willing to help me.
That person looks so fierce, I'm too scared to talk to them, I'll just leave it.
I'll ask them, and if they refuse, I'll guilt-trip them.

dialog.content: Alright, I think so too. Go ahead and ask.

(As expected, the person by the aisle was willing to switch seats with Li Fei. While the plane hadn't taken off for a while and Li Fei was just about to find a staff member to inquire, the person sitting next to him suddenly went berserk and lunged at the person by the window, biting down hard. Blood splattered everywhere, scaring Li Fei into quickly leaving his seat.) Wu Tong! Be careful, zombies! Get out of here quickly, there are zombies!
(Wu Tong had already put on an eye mask, ready to sleep) Huh? What? I'm in here.
Ah, now the whole cabin is in chaos. The rear of the plane is blocked by the infected, and the cabin door is also closed. What should we do?

I looked outside, and there are zombies all over the airport too. We can't go out, Li Fei. There are fewer zombies in first class, and we can also go to the toilet at the junction between first and economy class. I can't get out now. You should go first; first class is blocking the door. Quickly choose a place to hide. Which one will you pick?

content.content: (Calmly analyzing) I should still head to first class. Once the economy class turns into zombies, they'll definitely attack together. The restroom isn't safe either as the door can be easily broken.

question: #question# How can Li Fei demonstrate his ability to calmly handle and analyze the zombie situation on the plane and apply it to his escape plan? #skill# Information Processing Skill

content.content: (Hesitant) Wu Tong, which one should I choose? I don't know which is the best choice, but I want to pick the best one.
(Giving up struggle) I feel like I can't escape. Everything I'm doing is in vain. I should eventually turn into a zombie anyway.
What should I do, Wu Tong? The situation is too urgent, I can't think straight. I still want to ask for your opinion.

question: #question# How can Li Fei demonstrate his ability to empathize with the thoughts of the passengers in first class and make his own judgments?

content.content: (Hesitant) Wu Tong, do you know if there's anyone in the restroom? I don't know if there's anyone, I'm a bit scared to open it.
Okay, I've decided. I'll go to first class. There are more people inside, and we can help each other.
(Giving up and endangering others) If they won't let me into first class, I don't care about anything else; I'll let the zombies in to retaliate against them.

dialog.content: Alright, hurry up, there's no time!
(Li Fei hurriedly runs towards first class, but the people there are blocking the connecting passage) I really haven't been infected, please let me in!
The people in first class, afraid of infection, didn't let Li Fei in. Zombies have already caught up behind him, and it's too late to hide in the restroom. Li Fei is surrounded by zombies.
Run quickly, the zombies are about to catch you!

(Li Fei quickly runs into the bathroom and locks the door, the economy class is already filled with zombie noises) Sigh, there's only water in this bathroom, no food. Oh well, I don't have a better idea right now. I guess I'll stay here for now.

profile.name: Da Zhuang
profile.public profile: On the same plane as Li Fei, a passenger in first class. Very strong and a big guy, kind and generous.
profile.goal: Survive the zombie encounter on the plane.

dialog.content: (On the third day of the zombie virus outbreak, Da Zhuang comes out of first class looking for supplies and discovers the locked bathroom) Is there someone in the bathroom? Who’s inside? We're trying to move the zombies to the back of the cabin. Do you want to come with us to find food?

content.content: It's too dangerous outside, and I've already gotten used to hiding in the bathroom. There's water here, so I should be able to last a few days. I’m going to wait for rescue.

question: #question#What could Li Fei do to show he can quickly adapt to hiding in the bathroom to evade zombies?

content.content: Oh man, I've had enough of this. I'm starving! If you guys are going to find food, I'm going with you.
(frantically) I don't want to starve to death. Even if I become a zombie, I'm going out to find food.
(impatiently) Finally, a chance to get out! I can't stand another second in this toilet.
I don't want to hide in the bathroom anymore. I really feel like I'm going to starve. I'm going with you to find food!

question: #question#What could Li Fei do to show that while waiting for rescue, he can adjust his goals from just hiding to actively seeking a chance for survival?

content.content: (a bit hesitant) What’s your plan anyway? I have no idea, and I'm really scared of zombies.
(fearfully) It’s too dangerous outside. I’ll stay in the bathroom. Rescue should arrive soon. It’s my best shot.
You guys are a bunch of fools to go out and fight zombies. Not me; I’ve found a perfect hiding spot.

dialog.content: Alright, you just wait, and good luck!
(Starving for several more days with no rescue arriving, and the number of zombies not decreasing, Li Fei feels like he's floating on air) Sigh~ looks like I'm really going to starve to death here.
After two more days, Li Fei couldn't hold on any longer, but it was still slightly better than being eaten by zombies. Ultimately, Li Fei starved to death in the bathroom.
Alright, come out quickly!

(Li Fei hurriedly follows the team. Most of the zombies are strapped to their seats with seatbelts, but they keep reaching out trying to grab the team members. Since Li Fei hasn't eaten for a long time, he gets distracted and is pulled aside by a zombie.) Ahhh, I've been caught, help me!
Li Fei, lacking the strength to break free, finds himself ignored by everyone else in this emergency, and thus becomes a meal for the zombies.
Alright, just bear with it.

(After a long wait with the plane still not taking off, just when Li Fei was about to ask the staff, a passenger next to him suddenly went mad and bit into Li Fei's jacket. Luckily, it didn't pierce through, and Li Fei sat there for a while before shaking off the zombie that had bitten him.) Damn! Why are there zombies all over the aisle? This is bad.
The airplane aisle was full of zombies, and Li Fei was surrounded. A horde of zombies lunged at him, and with nowhere to escape, he was bitten to death by the zombies.

(The next morning, the two of them get on a bus to the airport. With over twenty stops left, the bus suddenly comes to an emergency halt, and the passengers start to get noisy. Li Fei looks ahead and sees that the bus driver has started fighting with a passenger. The passenger's strange behavior seemed like he wanted to bite the driver, but was quickly subdued. The driver got a minor scratch.) Looks like we'll have to wait for the police to arrive and take away the troublemaker before the bus can start and continue on its route.
Ah, what's going on? We're having such bad luck today!
Or we can go to a nearby stop and wait for the next bus to the airport. Li Fei, we still have plenty of time. Should we switch buses?

content.content: Let's switch buses. I'm worried the police might be late, or something else might go wrong on the way or at the airport. We should make the most of our time.

question: #question# How can Li Fei demonstrate his time management skills when trying to catch a flight?

content.content: (feeling tired) Wu Tong, I stayed up too late last night. I don't really want to walk any distance. Let's just wait here for the bus to move.
Are we sure switching buses is faster? I feel like getting off and finding the next one might take more time.
(feeling a bit hesitant) What do you think? Should we switch buses? Maybe waiting won't delay us too much.
We don't have much luggage, but dragging it is tiring. We're not very clear on how far the nearby bus stop is. The police should arrive soon. We have enough time; let's wait a bit longer.

question: #question# How can Li Fei make a well-considered decision about whether to switch buses?

content.content: We have to switch buses again? Unbelievable! What's wrong with that guy? Is he crazy, wasting our time like this, it's so annoying.
Wu Tong, let's switch. If the police never come and we miss the flight, we're doomed.
Old Wu, why do you always ask me? You always make me decide when something happens; you should make some decisions too.

dialog.content: (The two arrived at the nearby bus stop to wait. After enduring over an hour of jostling, they finally reached the airport) Ugh, finally here, thought that ride would shake me to death.

(Since it's the travel off-season, after going through security, as they were about to get their tickets at check-in, the staff offered them an opportunity to upgrade to a discounted first-class cabin) Really? I've never flown first class before. What do you think, Old Wu? Want to try a first-class experience?
I haven't even flown economy yet, so I'll stick to experiencing economy first. You go ahead if you want the upgrade.
Huh? Then I...
It's alright, if you want to upgrade, just do it. Do you want to?

content.content: I happen to have some money on hand, and considering I didn't sleep much last night and the bumpy morning ride, I need to recharge. I'll take the upgrade!

question: #question# How can Li Fei demonstrate he wants to upgrade to first class to recharge his energy?

content.content: Then I'll join you in economy class. How could I leave one brother behind?
(asking about the upgrade cost) Huh? This is the discounted price? My budget's tight, better not.
(dismissively) I feel there's hardly any difference between economy and first class. I’d rather save money for fun.
Let's save some cash for our trip. I didn't even buy that leather jacket last night. I need to keep at it, not upgrading.

question: #question# How does Li Fei show his resolve to prioritize saving money for the trip over the upgrade opportunity?

content.content: No way, I'm too exhausted. I want to rest in first class; economy is too cramped.
(internally exasperated) Wu Tong, can't you treat yourself a bit better? Always so reluctant to spend.
(lost interest) Alright, it's no fun going alone anyway.

dialog.content: (Both follow the crowd through the jet bridge to the cabin) Old Li, I'm going to find my seat. Let's meet at the exit after the flight.

profile.name: Da Zhuang
profile.public profile: A passenger in first class on the same flight as Li Fei, very strong and muscular, kind and generous.
profile.goal: Survive when encountering zombies on the plane.

dialog.content: (The flight attendant warmly escorts Li Fei to first class; as soon as Li Fei sits down, a passenger arrives next to him) Hi there, I'm your seatmate, you can call me Da Zhuang!

(As the plane prepares for takeoff, screams suddenly erupt from economy class) Ah, what's going on in economy class? Why do those people look like zombies from the movies, biting everyone around? Could they really be zombies? We should get the door open and escape!

No way, look outside the window, the airport is filled with infected people too; it's very dangerous to go out now. Let's block the door between economy and first class to keep the infected from getting in!
Good idea, let's quickly find something to block the door!

profile.name: Mechanic
profile.public profile: A mechanic on the plane with average professional skills, selfish and cowardly.
profile.goal: Survive when encountering zombies on the plane.

dialog.content: (As Li Fei searches for something near the cockpit door, someone suddenly appears) I'm the mechanic on the plane. What's going on outside?
(Li Fei briefly explains, and the mechanic hurriedly tries to go back) Hey, are you going back?
It was all normal in the cockpit when I came out. I think it's safer than first class. Do you want to join me in the cockpit?

content.content: I’m a little tempted but I’d rather stay and help everyone find something to block the door. If I go in and the door isn't blocked, the cockpit could be unsafe too. Teamwork leads to success.

question: #question# How does Li Fei's response to the mechanic show his emphasis on teamwork during the survival situation on the plane?

content.content: (Like finding a lifeline) Mechanic, please take me with you inside! I don't want to stay here; it's too scary outside.
(Grabbing tightly) How can you be a deserter? You're not allowed in either. Quickly find something to block the door, or we'll all be dead.
(Pleading) You're a lifesaver, please be kind and take me in too. I just want to hide; help me, please.
(Li Fei almost rushes into the cockpit but suppresses his impulse) Sorry, I got too excited. It’s too dangerous outside, please let me hide inside.

question: #question# What should Li Fei do to demonstrate his ability to restrain his impulse to storm into the cockpit?

content.content: (Darts into the cockpit before the mechanic can enter) Mechanic, I'm hiding in the cockpit too. I've made it in!
Mechanic, remember I'm a passenger on this flight. The customer is king. You should leave, I want to stay here.
(Grabbing the mechanic's arm) Hey, hey, hey, you can’t go in. This is such a safe place to hide from zombies, I'm going in. You go out!

dialog.content: Well, too bad I'm not that kind of person.

(Li Fei continues helping everyone barricade the door, just as they finish blocking it, someone outside starts banging, asking Li Fei to let him in, claiming he isn't infected) Da Zhuang, someone wants in, what should we do about this?
Huh? At this point, do you want to let them in or not?

content.content: We just blocked it, but I can't just ignore someone in need, my conscience won't allow it. After all, he’s a living person, still pleading desperately!

question: #question#What can Li Fei do to show he remains morally committed to saving others even right after barricading?

content.content: (Pretending not to hear to stall time) What? Da Zhuang, what are you saying? It's so noisy, I can't hear clearly.
This door was just nailed shut, Da Zhuang, everyone just finished blocking it, it's not very convenient to open it.
I'm barely surviving myself, can't worry about him. Let him take care of himself.
Wait a minute, don't rush, let me check the situation outside first. I seemed to notice a bloodstain on his back when he lowered his head just now, so don't act rashly yet.

question: #question#How can Li Fei demonstrate his attention to detail while preparing to rescue someone?

content.content: (Without any hesitation) Okay! I'll open the door immediately, let him in quickly!
(Hesitating) Oh my, I don't know what's going on outside, I'm afraid to make a move.
(Freaking out) Don't let him come over, or else he'll attract all the zombies here!

dialog.content: Alright, then you open it.
(As soon as Li Fei opened it, the survivors rushed in) Oh no, why are there so many infected following behind? No!
A horde of zombies poured into the first-class cabin, and it was instantly overrun, with not a single passenger surviving.
You're really thorough!
(A person suddenly screams as they are caught by the infected) Good thing we didn't open it, otherwise we'd be doomed.

profile.name: Flight Attendant
profile.public profile: A flight attendant on the plane, very mentally strong, excellent professional skills, intelligent and very helpful.
profile.goal: Survive the zombie encounter on the plane.

dialog.content: (Seeing the captain through the locked cockpit door) Everyone, don’t panic, have we gathered the resources from the first class cabin to see how much we have?
There’s not much food and water. Even if we ration it, it will run out in two to three days. We don’t even know when rescue will arrive.

I know a place where there is food and water, at the back of the economy class, there is a small compartment for food and water for all passengers. If we can get it, surviving for half a month is not a problem.

Why don’t we form a team now while we're still strong, and go through the economy class to get food and water? Most of the zombies are strapped in with seatbelts. Only a few can move freely, so there’s a chance we can make it. Li Fei, do you want to join?

content.content: I think the risk is still too high. Outside the first class cabin, it's all zombies. There's no guarantee the small compartment is safe or that the zombies in economy won't break free suddenly. I’d rather wait here.

question: #question#How can Li Fei reflect his ability to comprehensively analyze the current situation on the plane and then decide not to join the team?#skill# Information-Processing Skill

content.content: Since everyone thinks it’s possible, my attitude is to face hardships together, live and die together. Whatever happens, we face it together!
(Starts to give up) Honestly, I feel like it's a death sentence anyway, might as well wait here and die with some dignity.
Dazhuang, you don’t need to say anything. I don’t think there’s a better solution. You're right, let’s move. I’ll follow your lead and join.
Even though it seems a bit risky, we can look out for each other. I’m willing to team up with everyone to get the supplies.

question: #question#How can Li Fei demonstrate his willingness to cooperate with the team to acquire supplies?#skill# Teamwork Skill

content.content: (Too scared) Aren’t you guys afraid? I’m too scared, I can’t go. You go ahead.
(Turning to Dazhuang) Can you stay with me? I’m scared to stay here alone.
I don’t want to go. If we all go out, it's too much of a target and we’re more likely to get caught by zombies. I’d rather go alone.

dialog.content: Sigh, alright, I won't insist.
(Three days later, there's still no news of a rescue team, and the group set out) I hope you all come back safely.

Then, a few screams echoed from outside, the situation remained unknown. Ten minutes later, the economy class returned to silence. Li Fei and the remaining two or three people waited for a long time, but the group that went to gather resources didn’t return. The remaining people were too afraid to go out and could only continue to wait. By the seventh day of the zombie virus outbreak, standing became a challenge due to hunger. As time went by and there was still no news of a rescue team, Li Fei and the others couldn’t hold on and eventually succumbed to starvation.
Alright, I knew I didn't misjudge you!
By the way, Dazhuang, I forgot my jacket. Can you lend me one so I don't accidentally get caught?
(As the food is about to run out, the team prepares to depart) Put on your clothes, we're heading out. Everyone, stay alert!

(When reaching the rear cabin of the plane, only Li Fei, Dazhuang, and another passenger remain) Oh my god, the losses are devastating. Even zombies strapped to seats can drag people away. Let's hurry and search for resources!

(Indeed there's a lot of food and water) Now the problem is how do we get back? Maybe we shouldn't go back. There's enough food here to last a month, but the people in first class might not hold out for long. It's an impossible situation, so what do you think, Li Fei? Do you agree?

content.content: Dazhuang, I agree. I trust you now and think you're right. I'll do as you say.
I don't want to trust you, Dazhuang. If you can betray the people in first class, you could stab me in the back when danger comes.
I don't trust anyone. In such perilous times, I should believe in myself and head back.
(Mentally unhinged) Ahhhh, I can't take it anymore. I'm going to fight those zombies!

question: #question#What can Li Fei say to show he fully trusts Dazhuang and agrees with the decision not to go back?

content.content: (Very angry) Dazhuang, I never expected you to be such a selfish person.
But the people in first class are still waiting for us. How can we break our promise?
Dazhuang, how do you know we can't go back? What if we get lucky and make it back?
We need to keep our promise, otherwise the people in first class are likely doomed. We can take back some of the useful supplies.

question: #question#How can Li Fei's actions show that he's still committed to fulfilling the promise by bringing supplies back to first class?

content.content: Dazhuang, you just spoke my mind. I really don't want to go back either; the economy class route is too dangerous, and those zombies are terrifying.
Dazhuang, have you really decided not to go back? You're the person I trust the most here, so if you've made up your mind, I'll follow your lead.
This decision truly does a disservice to those in first class, but we have no choice. Not going back means less danger; even if we return, it's likely to be a fatal journey.

dialog.content: (Another person also agrees not to return) Sigh, we really don't have a choice, otherwise we wouldn't be able to ensure our own safety.
I hope they can hold on, and I also hope the rescue team gets here quickly.

Thus, the three of them survived for half a month on the food and water in the cabin, until the rescue team finally arrived. Luckily, the airport was the primary target, otherwise the wait for rescue would have been much longer. Unfortunately, the people in first class didn't make it; only these three survived the entire plane.
If you want to leave, just go. I'm staying here anyway.
(Li Fei and another person who was willing to accompany him back grabbed some food and water before heading out) We're leaving. You've really let me down.

However, the journey back for Li Fei this time was even more difficult than before. Before they reached the halfway point, they were surrounded by zombies. Many infected rushed at them, and the two of them also became part of the zombie horde.
(Worn out by Li Fei's persistent pleading) Fine, fine, just don't touch anything!
(Before entering the cockpit, Li Fei suddenly thinks of his neighbor Da Zhuang) Mechanic, can I bring my friend along?
Why do you have so many requests? Having too many people is complicated. You can only bring one. Who’s it going to be, that big guy?

question: #question# How can Li Fei's response to the mechanic demonstrate his independence?

content.content: Yeah, that's him, Mechanic. Can I bring this friend in to take cover?
(Hesitantly) There are several, I can't decide. Let me draw lots.
I'll go ask Da Zhuang if he wants to enter the cockpit first. What if he doesn't want to?
Right, he's a smart and capable person. Bringing him along might help us escape. I've made up my mind to bring him.

question: #question# How can Li Fei demonstrate thoughtful decision-making in choosing to bring Da Zhuang to the cockpit?

content.content: (Mind in a muddle) With your question, I don't even know whether to bring him or not. I'm so conflicted.
(Gives up) Forget it, whatever, just the two of us. We won't bring him.
Whether to bring Da Zhuang or not, it's up to the mechanic's advice. I'll listen to you.

dialog.content: Should have thought of that earlier; go on in!
(Li Fei jumps as he enters) What? Both pilots have turned into zombies! Thank goodness they're strapped in. That's terrifying!
They were fine just now, how did they get infected? If the pilots are infected, flying somewhere else is going to be tricky. I don't really know how to fly.
What! You can't fly the plane?
I'm a mechanic, not a pilot. Whatever I learned back in the day, I've long forgotten. I wouldn't dare fly. So what do we do next?

content.content: In that case, let’s follow my plan and head back to the cabin. While we're at it, we can find others and come up with a solution. Maybe someone in there can fly a plane.

question: #question#How can Li Fei make the mechanic follow his plan to return to the cabin?

content.content: We can't fly, but we could give it a go. What if we succeed?
Honestly, mechanic, do what you want. I don’t want to stay in the cockpit. I'm leaving.
(Threatening) Get out of here with me, mechanic. You're not allowed to stay here, or I’ll feed you to the zombies.
Mechanic, since you've studied it, those memories will come back once triggered. I believe in you, just fly it. We don’t have time!

question: #question#How can Li Fei persuade the mechanic to attempt flying the plane?

content.content: Oh my gosh, that's terrifying. You've forgotten, eh? Well, maybe I should give flying a try. I've never flown a plane, but I've been a passenger!
Mechanic, do you have any better ideas? I'll follow whatever you decide, I don’t want to die.
Why don't we just try flying? It might just work. Or we could wait a bit longer. Either way is fine by me.

dialog.content: Yes, you're right!

(The two quickly return to first class to help continue blocking the door. After a moment, the door is secured) The door is secured, but there's way too little food and water. If we're waiting for rescue, this won't last long.

I know there's a small compartment at the back of the plane that has food and water for all the passengers. If we can get it, everyone can hold out for half a month, making rescue more likely. But to get there, we'd have to pass through the economy section, which is overrun with zombies—extremely dangerous!
I know there's a maintenance access passage in first class that leads to the place the flight attendant just mentioned. I know the way and can take you there.
Since we don't know the situation, let's form a small team and head there together. We can look out for each other. Li Fei, what do you think—are you in?

content.content: Let's have us guys go, leaving the elderly and children here. We'll take responsibility for getting the food!

question: #question# How can Li Fei show that he's actively taking on the responsibility and risking himself to find food?

content.content: Da Zhuang, aren't you scared? I sure am. I'm scared, I don't want to go. You go help find the food.
Mechanic, are you serious? Do we really have to form a team? Can't it be voluntary?
Don't ask me, I'm a coward. Go find someone else. Find some food.

question: #question# How can Li Fei answer in a way that shows he prefers to act alone?

content.content: I agree to join; I'm pretty strong and can carry more supplies.
I'm a bit worried that the back of the plane has already been overrun too. I'm not going, you guys go.
If we're going, everyone should go. After all, we share the hardship and the benefits.

dialog.content: Alright, everyone follow me then!
(Five minutes later) We've arrived, thank goodness there are no zombies here; otherwise, we might not make it. Let's quickly use something to barricade the hatch to prevent zombies from getting in.
(After blocking the door, everyone starts searching for supplies) Great, we actually found a large amount of food and water here! Let's grab what we can and head back.

Wait a moment, we don't know how long we'll have to wait for the rescue team. If we take the food and water back, it has to be divided among so many people. What if we run out before help arrives? Why don't we block the pipes and just stay here?
What! Not going back? Li Fei, what do you think?

content.content: Makes sense, we've been doing all this to survive, and it seems there's little risk of mistakes now. So let's stay here.
(Embarrassed) This doesn't feel right. How can we be so selfish? We should go back.
No, we came out here with a mission. We must complete it, no matter what, and not abandon it due to our own greed.
(Turns to Da Zhuang) Da Zhuang, what do you think? Should we go back or not? I'll go with your decision.

question: #question#What actions demonstrate that Li Fei wants to survive from the start?

content.content: How can we be treacherous people? We will face the consequences.
No, even if it means death, I must get the supplies back. I refuse to be a villain.
Da Zhuang, do you really want to stay? You wouldn't, would you? I won't misjudge you.
(Li Fei holds back the urge to slap the Mechanic, takes a deep breath) We came here for supplies! They're still waiting for us to bring them back, so stop talking nonsense and let's go back!
(Shouts directly) What! Mechanic, I can't believe it, I truly regret bringing you along. How could you be this sort of person?
Da Zhuang, come help me hold these things; I need to punch some sense into him. Thinking of staying here alone, I'm really fed up with him.
Da Zhuang, let's ignore him, take the supplies, and go back by ourselves. Let everyone see what kind of person he really is.

question: #question#How did Li Fei manage his anger towards the Mechanic's selfish comments?

content.content: (A loud slap) Mechanic, this slap is to teach you a lesson. How could you think like that? Don't be so selfish.
Mechanic, you do have a bit of a point. If we don't go back, there's more food for us, and we can last longer. So let's not go back.
Da Zhuang, I can't stand the Mechanic anymore. Can you believe he said that? Let’s team up and give him a beating.

dialog.content: Alright, if we're not going back, let's quickly block the passageway cover.
No worries, even if we don't block it, it'll be hard for the people in first class to find it.

Days passed by, and finally, after nearly half a month, the rescue team arrived, and the three were successfully rescued. However, the people in first class weren't so lucky. Only the three of them survived the entire plane crash.
I think so too. How could there be a betrayal? Let's hurry back!
Alright, I can't win against you guys.
(After returning, everyone carefully took stock) Not bad, it should last us for half a month.
And so, the days went by. About fifteen days later, the rescue team finally arrived just before the supplies ran out, and Li Fei, along with all the first-class passengers, were successfully rescued.
(A few tall guys are willing to go) Alright, since that's the case, we're off.
The team set out three days ago and hasn't returned, and we're out of food. Let's all go into the maintenance tunnels to find them.
Alright, there's no other option.

Little did they know, the tunnels were a bewildering maze. Having no other choice, Li Fei randomly picked a path, which unexpectedly led to the economy class. The corridor was too narrow to escape back, and they became a feast for the zombies.
(with a determined look) Alright! I'll give it a try!
(The two manage to deal with the zombie pilot and start maneuvering the plane to the runway for takeoff) Mechanic, keep it up!
However, the mechanic was indeed not very skilled, and as the plane accelerated, it veered off the runway and instantaneously caught fire and exploded.
Alright, pull him in quick!
(Li Fei quickly pulls in Da Zhuang who is blocking the door) Da Zhuang! Come with me!
(Upon entering, discovers both pilots have turned into zombies) Luckily they're strapped in with seatbelts and pose no threat. Oh dear, there are zombies here too!
They were fine when we left, what happened? Now that the pilots are infected, flying to another location is difficult. I'm not really good at flying; it's too much for me.
Actually, I can fly a plane, but just a bit. If I cooperate with the mechanic it shouldn't be a problem.
(Shocked) What! You can fly?
Yes, so should I fly? What should we do now?

content.content: We don't have time, the zombies have already entered first class. You two fly, let's get ready to take off immediately!

question: #question# How should Li Fei act to show he's decisive and wasting no time in deciding to take off? #skill#Time Management

content.content: (Hesitant) What should I do, I'm so torn, I don't know what decision to make.
(A bit unsure) Are you sure you can fly and escape safely? Nothing's going to happen in mid-air, right?
Can we just take off without permission? Should we report to our superiors first?
Everyone stay calm, there's always more solutions than problems. The risk is still a bit high if we take off right now. How about we wait for rescue, and if there’s no other option, then we’ll fly.

question: #question# How does Li Fei calm everyone down and analyze the situation to make a decision when deciding whether to fly? #skill#Stress Regulation

content.content: (Emotionally breaking down) Aaaaah, what do I do what do I do, am I going to die here?
Da Zhuang, I'm going crazy, I don't know what to do anymore, you decide.
Do we even have to think? Fly! You two hurry and fly the plane; let's quickly get to another place for rescue, I don’t want to die!

dialog.content: (Dazhuang and the Mechanic begin to operate the plane; after taxiing down the runway, it wobbles into the sky) Great, we did it!
We're now flying along the route to a city 600 kilometers away. Let's see if there are any infected people over there.

(As they're about to reach the outskirts of the city, a fighter jet approaches them and issues a radio warning not to enter. If they proceed, they will be shot down) They must be afraid there are infected people on our plane.
Ah, what should we do? Should we turn back or keep going?

content.content: Alright, they've given the order, so we have no choice but to comply. Let's head back, they're not accepting us here.

question: #question# How can Li Fei demonstrate his adherence to the fighter jet's instructions to return the plane?

content.content: (Hesitant) What should we do? I don't want to turn back; below us are all zombies.
Forget it, we're not turning back. Let's see what they can do!
(Impatiently) What's wrong with this plane, it's really annoying. If they keep interfering, we'll crash directly.
They might just be bluffing. Shooting us down mid-air would have serious consequences when the plane crashes, they probably won't act rashly. So don't be afraid, we'll keep going.
(Furious) Mechanic, wasn't it you who led the route? Why won't they let us in?
Since no one knows what to decide, let's leave it to fate. We'll draw lots to decide.

question: #question# How can Li Fei show that he made a thoughtful decision to continue flying?

content.content: Alright, they've told us not to fly, let's just listen and head back.
What should we do, Mechanic? Quickly, tell us what we should do.
We're doomed, we're not allowed to go here or there, we have nowhere to go!

dialog.content: (The three of them had no choice but to return to land at the original airport, but the runway was in complete chaos, filled with zombies and vehicle wreckage.) We can't land here. Let's take off again and find another runway.
However, due to their lack of experience, the plane suddenly went out of control and crashed onto the runway, followed by a severe explosion, resulting in the immediate death of all three.
(Braving himself to continue flying) The fighter jet really didn't attack us. Look, it's even sending us a radio message saying they're escorting us to a safe zone. That's fantastic!
(Very excited and happy) This is wonderful, we're saved!
The three followed the fighter jet to the designated airport. After a successful landing, they were placed under a month-long quarantine, but thankfully, they survived.
I also think we should wait for rescue first, and fly only if necessary.
(Two days later) We're out of food, and the rescue team still hasn't arrived. Let's fly the plane out of here!

Just as the three were preparing to take off, they discovered that the airport was in complete chaos, with zombies and wrecked vehicles everywhere. Da Zhuang and the mechanic couldn't start the airplane's engine and didn't even know what the problem was. They were thoroughly trapped in the cockpit, and as days passed, the three of them still couldn't hold on until the rescue team arrived.
(After getting their tickets, the two of them wait in the lounge) Come on, Old Li, let's board the plane!
(Just after sitting down, two people walked up to Li Fei and started talking to him) Wu Tong, the passenger in the same aisle seat wants to swap seats with me for a window seat?
What's up with that? It's up to you if you want to switch or not.

content.content: I'm always happy to help others, and if I can make someone else happy, why not? I'll switch with him.

question: #question# How can Li Fei demonstrate his willingness to help by swapping seats with a stranger?

content.content: Old Wu, I really prefer the window seat, so I don't want to switch.
(Speaking out loud) He can buy his own seat if he wants to sit anywhere else, why trouble me? I don't have time for this.
He looks too fierce; I don't want to switch with him. Let him find someone else to swap with!
I've already put all my stuff away, and I don't want to rearrange everything again. I'm feeling a bit tired and don't want the hassle, so I won't switch.

question: #question# How does Li Fei manage to organize his personal space and belongings well on the plane? #skill# Organizational Skill

content.content: (Embarrassed) It's a bit messy over here, I'm a little too embarrassed to switch seats with him.
I don't want to keep moving my things around, let him ask someone else about switching.
I don't want to switch, so I'll just pretend I didn't hear. My hearing isn't great anyway.

dialog.content: Sure, he’ll definitely be happy!

(Li Fei moved to a seat near the corridor, waiting for the plane with no activity. Just as he was about to find a staff member to inquire, the person next to him suddenly went crazy and lunged at the person sitting by the window, biting them. Li Fei was stunned, and as he started to leave his seat, he felt himself being grabbed as well) Ahhhhh, don't grab me, no!

The person showed no sign of letting go, instead gripping even harder. With Li Fei wearing a short-sleeved shirt today, his skin was directly scratched open, and the intense pain made him feel dizzy, his consciousness gradually blurring, until he slowly lost awareness and turned into a zombie.
Okay, just go ahead and tell them directly.

(The person didn't insist either, and after waiting for a long time without the plane showing any sign of taking off, just as Li Fei was about to ask the staff what was going on, the passenger sitting next to him suddenly bit his arm like a madman.) Ah! Just because I didn't agree to switch seats, you're biting me? Are you insane?

The sudden scene left Li Fei utterly baffled, and since he was sitting in the innermost seat with little space, he couldn't escape the zombie's biting in time. After a while, Li Fei felt dizzy, his consciousness gradually faded, and he did not survive.
Alright, I think that makes sense too. Let's wait a bit longer then.

(Shortly after, the police arrived and hurriedly took the passenger away. The vehicle continued its journey, but after a while, it suddenly accelerated at an alarming speed, startling Li Fei) Huh? What's going on?

Before the passengers had a chance to react, the vehicle lost control and crashed into a roadside building. The severe impact rendered everyone inside unconscious, and the car was engulfed in flames. Unfortunately, Li Fei and Wu Tong perished in the accident.
